reviews.review:
[h1] GREAT GAME [/h1] 

The graphics are stunning considering that this is an old game. Good story and fighting mechanics. Best Game from Valve
haf lif but beter

A good game, but inferior to HL1. Enemy variety is extremely poor and the weapon sandbox is a noticeable downgrade over HL1's exceptional host of weapons. HL2's really excels with its implementation of Valve's advanced physics engine that still holds up. Once the gravity gun is introduced puzzles, enemy encounters, and exploration becomes more dynamic; without the physics half life 2 would be another by the books shooter. The graphical presentation and artstyle has aged remarkably well, so if visuals are important to you then HL2 will not fail to deliver. Valve failed to live up to HL1, but HL2 is still a worthwhile experience to any fan of the FPS genre.

04年的游戏，画质可以说是非常棒了，到现在看来都不算差
剧情：内容紧凑。不像刺客信条，巫师这样，给你一个空荡荡的过场cg。半条命的剧情触发总是能引人入胜，让你能够不费力气就能明白究竟发生了什么事
操作手感：射击手感比一代好很多，但是还是有点奇怪，最简单的难度大约花11h能通关
Epic.

The game itself and story are great, I can see why people love this franchise!

But to me, just like portal 2, this game lacks self awareness to how to get through some missions. For example, in the *dreading* boat mission where the valve is broken, you need to blow up these oddly placed explosive containers to have an item break the bridge. Although not anything new, I spent 20 minutes trying to see if I missed anything because I didn't think id have to blow them up as they are always scattered around the map and you don't have to shoot them.

The boat mission was repetitive and the motion was annoying. I gave up during the boat mission cause i could never tell if I had to get off the boat or keep shooting.

Although I personally dont like story based puzzle games, this is not a bad game at all, just not my cup of tea. Id give this a 50/50 if i could but you should def try it if you want to, just wait till its on sale though!

Where it goes beyond a typical first person shooter is in its story telling. The graphics engine is so realistic that you feel like you are participating in a movie. The character's facial animation is incredible. It's done so well, you can get a sense of how the characters are feeling.

The classic gold standard for the cerebral FPS. The Half-Life series did away with stats and levels and shallow gameplay, to create a world full of dynamism, pathos, and the freedom to kill or not kill, explore or not explore. The beauty of a Valve game is that every piece is polished, beautiful, and smooth. All the elements that might remind you you're in a game are stripped away, so that the immersion is total and endless. 

HL2 is a fabulous story, fantastic gameplay, and even though Valve has yet to "wrap up" this great story, what exists already is worth it. Play the Half-Life games, play the Portal games, play Alyx, and bask in the glory of it all.

Very cool

If portal was my favorite game of all time Half life 2 is a very close second. The campaign is unlike any other. In scale it is tremendous. The settings go from an abandoned town to a massive city. The individual levels are incredible too. The boat part is the closest to a boring moment this game has. But even still, thats strict. The fact that this game came out almost 20 years ago is fucking amazing. There is next to no flaws visually. The goddamn beautiful visuals are something to admire. Half life 2 is one of the greatest games I have ever played and certainly my favorite FPS ever made
Fun, easy to learn, and everything along those lines.
Everyone needs to play this game. NOTHING needs to be said about excellent of a game Half-Life 2 is.

Holy shit man, this game was fuckin great. I was extremely surprised to see how well the physics and overall feel of the game felt. Half life 2 is so ahead of it's time, it's not even funny. All the praise I've always seen given to this game finally makes sense to me. Great game, just buy it man. Play Half life 1 too, which is a lot older but still pretty fun (although half life 1's fov was pretty nausea inducing, so you might wanna change it's fov using the console).

gorfin frelman

Extremely compelling story and fantastic sequel to the original game.  Graphics are decent for the time, though some of the facial expressions are hilariously incorrect for the tone of speech.  Overall, I would have paid $10 for this experience, though getting it for $2 during the summer sale was a welcome surprise.  I haven't played too many games that are story-driven, but this story packs a punch an leaves a lasting impression.  10/10 experience.  The only gripe I have is with the final boss battle, as it is about as good as the battle in hl1 in terms of combat/strategy.  It is more than made up for with the way the story comes to a close, though.

This whole time I had been sleeping on a masterpiece. Great combat and great levels all around. Engaging story with well written characters. An atmospheric soundtrack featuring the best from Half-Life 1. I don't need to tell you how influential this game was for the industry, you probably already knew that. Take my word when I say that this is a must-try.

Completely ignoring what the game did in the past and just from how it plays today it's still a superb game. The pacing is great, combat is fun and the game can be challenging depending on how you play. Who knew that lunging over tables and spraying bullets everywhere isn't a good tactic to stay unharmed? Who knew it was super fun? Purely talking vanilla here without taking the tons upon tons of mods into consideration. Solid game worth the money.
